Method Detail

getClassesInPackage

public static java.util.List<java.lang.Class> getClassesInPackage(java.lang.String packageName)
                                                           throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Gets a list of all classes found in a particular package. This method was taken from http://forum.java.sun.com/thread.jspa?threadID=341935&start=15.

Parameters:
packageName - the name of the package to search for classes
Returns:
a list of classes in the given package
Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if there is an error while searching for the classes

getSubclassesInPackage

public static java.util.List<java.lang.Class> getSubclassesInPackage(java.lang.String packageName,
                                                                     java.lang.Class superClass)
                                                              throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Gets a list of classes in a package that are subclasses of a given class. This list will include both direct subclasses, and classes that are subclassed through multiple levels of inheritance.

Parameters:
packageName - the name of the package to search
superClass - all classes that are subclasses of this will be included in the list
Returns:
list of subclasses of the given superClass
Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if there is a problem searching the package for classes

isClassSubclassOfClass

public static boolean isClassSubclassOfClass(java.lang.Class classToTest,
                                             java.lang.Class superClass)
Checks to see if a given class is a subclass of a given super class. All levels of the super class hierarchy are checked.

Parameters:
classToTest - the class to test
superClass - the super class to test against
Returns:
true if classToTest is a subclass of superClass; false otherwise
